title: Full Stack Engineer (Mid/Senior) - React/Redux/Node/Express - RedShift Digital at Source Coders (San Francisco, CA)
description:
We are looking for a full-stack engineer who is proficient with React, Node and modern JavaScript. Experience with serverless architecture and AWS is a plus. As a smaller team, all of our engineers work across the full stack, though most specialize on the frontend or backend to some extent. A commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and quality product is essential.


Responsibilities:



  • Developing new user-facing features using React

  • Building reusable components and frontend libraries for future use

  • Translating designs and wireframes into high quality code. As a design firm, we prize attention to detail

  • Writing tests for components and API integrations

  • Optimizing components for maximum performance across a vast array of web capable devices and browsers

  • Participating in and contributing to product design discussions

  • Systems architecture and design


Skills (most of the following):



  • Strong proficiency in JavaScript, including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model

  • Experience with React or similar frameworks

  • Familiarity with newer specifications of ECMAScript

  • Experience with data structure libraries (e.g. Immutable.js)

  • Knowledge of modern authorization mechanisms, such as JSON Web Token

  • Experience with common frontend development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc.

  • Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements

  • Familiarity with code versioning tools. We use Git.

title: Plenario Data Developer at Urban Center for Computation and Data (University of Chicago) (Lemont, IL)
description:
The Plenario Platform is a publicly available system for discovery of open data sets. We work with many providers of data including the Array of Things project, various governments and municipal groups such as the City of Chicago Data Office, universities, scientific groups, and other various private interests. We provide a system for our partners to register data sets that we then index and provide a graphical, web based interface for anyone to explore the provided data sets.
Part of this mission includes building a long term archiving system specifically for Array of Things and other Waggle enabled devices. Plenario is used primarily for data discovery; the archival system will provide long term, robust information for scientific usage.
This job will involve working with several teams to develop a system for handling the archiving process and relaying meta data about the stored information to partners. You will work under the Plenario team, but the scope of work will enable you to work with many different groups to achieve a successful integration with the various systems.


Under direct supervision, codes, tests, maintains, and debugs new, or enhances existing, applications or programs. May collect and/or determine specifications from discussions with stakeholders. Reviews and analyzes business and technical requirements. Documents workflows associated with business requirements. Determines hardware requirements for the accomplishment of goals. Develops programs according to specifications. Helps to solve routine to moderately complex problems and works on all phases of application development and programming activities. Participates in component design, programming, code reviews, and unit testing. Designs and develops technology and models for development projects as assigned. Performs code testing on components and works to ensure
appropriate implementation standards are met. Provides support and maintenance for existing
applications and participates in production support during business hours and pre-launch hours. Recommends solutions for problems and makes enhancements to programs. Builds queries to update or
extract data for reporting purposes. Develops user manuals. Works with technical staff to learn and
understand programming problems. Resolves customer complaints and responds to suggestions for
improvements and enhancements from end-users. May produce written documentation of project
development and programming code.


Education



  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field

  • OR at least three years of relevant experience required.


Experience



  • Python experience required.

  • Github experience required.

  • AWS and virtual/cloud systems experience preferred.

  • Experience with multi-institutional collaborative projects preferred.

  • Commitment to providing a high level of service and working with a diverse team environment required.

  • High degree of professionalism required.

  • Attention to detail and strong communication skills required.


Unit Job Function Competencies



  • Ability to work effectively with a diverse population of staff, partners, faculty, and constituents required.

  • Ability to work independently is required.

title: Senior Systems Engineer at Entrepreneurial Finance Lab (Cambridge, MA)
description:
About the Position:


This is an exciting opportunity to join a rapidly growing financial technology social impact business as a Senior Systems Engineer. You will play an important role in supporting and transforming the core technology of a leading alternative credit scoring SaaS product company. We are looking for a driven individual who has a passion for the art and science of DevOps, release management, security and production environments.


The Senior Systems Engineer will play a key role in supporting existing infrastructure and developing the strategy for our next generation efforts. This person will support and augment the current team, bridge the technologies between current and next, and help lead the strategy and implementation of new technologies. These improved tools, technologies, and processes will enable us to deliver our products and services more quickly, more safely, and more effectively.


Primary Responsibilities:


Infrastructure, Systems, and Deployments




    Design and implement future state SaaS infrastructure.




    Analyze a variety of approaches to a DevOps problem – provide pros and cons of different approaches to the team to arrive at an agreed upon direction.




    Enable and implement future state continuous delivery and continuous integration.




    Collaborate to incorporate automated unit, integration, functional, and performance testing into the continuous integration pipelines across multiple projects.




    Collaborate with the Development, Project Management, and Product Management teams to align projects, releases, patches, and other efforts.




    Evolve and automate our processes to provide increased flexibility related to the development and testing of multiple simultaneous projects.




    Build and deploy the application level software in our development and test regions.




    Maintain and migrate existing Jenkins+Ansible CI pipelines.




Monitoring & Security




    Configure alerts, monitor systems, prioritize and troubleshoot development and test region issues.




    Keep up-to-date with security patches and proactively address security vulnerabilities in EFL systems.




Management




    Manage cloud hosting services and budget.




    Create operations handbook and playbook as required for others to assist in the administration.




    Manage remote junior DevOps engineer based in Jakarta, including providing regular feedback, semi-annual coaching, and fostering development.




Who’s a good fit?


The right candidate is competent, friendly, driven, and autonomous. They desire ownership of whole areas of responsibility, can define team goals based on company and group goals, and can manage and grow direct reports.


Required Qualifications:




    5+ years previous experience in DevOps / Systems Engineer role




    Experience with AWS




    Experience with the Ansible configuration management tool




    Experience with the Jenkins continuous integration system




    Experience with VM and Docker containers




    Experience deploying Django/python apps




    Linux systems admin (Ubuntu preferred)




    2+ years experience managing direct reports




Preferred Qualifications:




    Puppet, Chef, Travis CI, Bamboo, TeamCity




    Ubuntu, Zabbix, Debian packaging, Python, MySQL, MongoDB




    Any level of proficiency in Spanish




What is it like to work at EFL?


We’re a group of motivated, smart people trying to tackle a big problem! Our team is driven to make a big social impact. As a fast-growing, innovative, company, our culture is entrepreneurial, progressive, fast-paced, and multicultural. With offices in Lima, Boston, Mexico City, Jakarta, Nairobi, and Bangalore we are truly a multinational.  You’ll gain significant exposure to the world of entrepreneurship, emerging market finance and big data, and enjoy an awesome annual company retreat in Peru! We encourage our staff to think of EFL not just as their employer, but also as their own company. Have an idea to do things better? Implement it. Want flexibility in your schedule? Enjoy it. Want to make an impact? Own it.


We Offer Some Great Perks:




    Flexible work schedule and generous time off, paid sabbatical and parental leave




    Down-to-earth, motivated, collaborative team!




    Annual company retreat in Latin America




    Opportunities for international travel

title: Senior Web Developer at Entrepreneurial Finance Lab (Cambridge, MA)
description:
About the Position:


EFL is seeking a Senior Software Engineer (JavaScript) to take our successful web product to the next level! You will will work closely with our product and platform teams but will ultimately be responsible for delivering our web offering. This position will own the direction and implementation of this successful product. The job is rewarding but also challenging and we are seeking the right person to help us!


Primary Responsibilities:



  • Chart the course for EFL as we build out our next generation web product

  • Work closely with EFL product managers, designers and field researchers to plan, design and implement highly innovative front-end user experiences

  • Continually deliver high-quality, tested code


Who’s a good fit?


We are looking for someone who is passionate about the quality of the products they deliver.  They enjoy digging into code to learn how it works, and they are driven to build the best solution to every problem.  The right candidate is a conceptual thinker, able to distill any complex problem into its essential elements and also a great communicator, able to convey important insights and understanding.


Required Qualifications:



  • 5+ years experience of front-end development using JavaScript

  • Strong software engineering fundamentals

  • Expertise developing end-user UI using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Angular and jQuery

  • Excellent software engineering habits: object-oriented design, unit testing, integration testing, data structures, etc.

  • Eye for visual design and good user-experience instincts

  • Experience with cross-browser design

  • Intermediate or Advanced proficiency node.js

  • Intermediate or Advanced proficiency with REST and SOAP


Preferred Qualifications:



  • Android, Python, Django, AWS, NoSQL experience

  • Experience with low-bandwidth design considerations

  • BS in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent degree


What is it like to work at EFL?


We’re a group of motivated, smart people trying to tackle a big problem! Our team is driven to make a big social impact. As a fast-growing, innovative, company, our culture is entrepreneurial, progressive, fast-paced, and multicultural. With offices in Lima, Boston, Mexico City, Jakarta, Nairobi, and Bangalore we are truly a multinational.  You’ll gain significant exposure to the world of entrepreneurship, emerging market finance and big data, and enjoy an awesome annual company retreat in Peru! We encourage our staff to think of EFL not just as their employer, but also as their own company. Have an idea to do things better? Implement it. Want flexibility in your schedule? Enjoy it. Want to make an impact? Own it.


We Offer Some Great Perks:



  • Flexible work schedule and generous time off, paid sabbatical and parental leave

  • Down-to-earth, motivated, collaborative team!

  • Annual company retreat in Latin America

  • Opportunities for international travel

title: Sr. Frontend Developer (React) for AI & Cyber Security Company! at Cylance (Austin, TX)
description:
Cylance is the fastest growing company in the Artificial Intelligence & Cyber Security space and is looking to hire a Senior Frontend Developer to join our team in Austin!


Must have strong experience with React!


You:


- Strong JavaScript experience and solid skills with modern frameworks (React required)


- Experience with Git (or at least a proficiency with it and eagerness to learn more about it)


- Understanding of common design patterns and object oriented principles 


- Enjoy collaboration and ability to learn quickly with a willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies


- Strong work ethic and sense of humor!


What you will do:


- Collaborate with peers on design, estimation and implementation of all things front-end (React)


- Work closely with architecture team to build optimal content delivery strategy to optimize customer experience 


- Perform peer review of source code to monitor best practices, level of effort and documentation


- Work with keep business stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical requirements and collaborate with backend team to build RESTful APIs for front-end integration

title: Senior Front-End Developer at 84.51Â° (Cincinnati, OH)
description:
Senior Front End Developer – What you’ll do


While 84.51° is a data shop, big data is useless until it reaches Kroger, internal customers, and CPG’s. Using the latest web, cloud, and mobile technologies, we build insightful, visualized dashboards available on any device—web, phone, and tablet—and at any time.



Responsibilities:


Take ownership of stories and drive them to completion through all phases of the entire 84.51° SDLC.  This includes external facing and internal applications as well as process improvement activities such as:



  • Perform development in Angular2/JavaScript

  • Build reusable code and libraries

  • Perform unit and integration testing

  • Partner with senior resources, gaining insights

  • Participate in retrospective reviews

  • Participate in the estimation process for new work and releases

  • Bring new perspectives to problems

  • Be driven to improve yourself and the way things are done



Requirements:



  • Bachelor’s degree (Master’s degree desired) typically in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Mathematics, Business Analytics or another technically strong program.

  • Understanding of Agile Principles (Scrum)

  • 5+ years of experience in JavaScript

  • 5+ years of experience with various advanced JavaScript library/framework such as Angular or ReactJS

  • Proficient in HTML5, CSS3

  • Proficient in async request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX

  • Proficient in Object Oriented Principles

  • Proficient using RESTful APIs

  • Experience with VCS (Git, SVN)

  • Experience with cross-browser compatibility issues and how to handle them

  • Experience with reverse proxies

  • Experience with CI/CD

  • Understanding SOLID principles




Preferred Skills – Experience in the following



  • Experience with CSS pre-processing platform (SASS or LESS)



  • Python

  • Java

  • SQL

  • Cross-browser compatibility issues and how to handle them

  • Reverse proxies

title: Full Stack Software Engineer at Profitable Startup at DataKitchen (Cambridge, MA)
description:
DataKitchen, Inc. enables analytic teams to deliver value quickly, with high quality, using the tools that they love. DataKitchen provides the world’s first DataOps platform for data-driven enterprises, enabling them to support data analytics that can be quickly and robustly adapted to meet evolving requirements. DataKitchen is leading the DataOps movement to incorporate Agile Software Development, DevOps, and manufacturing based statistical process control into analytics and data management.


Our company is profitable, stable, rapidly growing (100% ARR growth so far this year). We own the company -- so we think long-term without investor timelines.


As a member of the DataKitchen Product Development Team, you will help build all layers of our DataOps product. This role involves designing and implementing core python, angular, javascript in a modern cloud-based stack. You will work closely with company founders and our customers.


Stack = (Angular, CoffeeScript, Python, AWS, big data, docker, Mesos, mongodb, git, vault)


Skills & Requirements



  • 2+ years software development experience with a record of delivering successful products.

  • You should have some experience in a cloud-first environment like AWS.  

  • Great Python and Angular/Javascript skills

  • Experience in Docker and devops

  • Highly effective written and verbal communication skills with a collaborative work style

title: Senior Software Engineer at Veritone, Inc. (Costa Mesa, CA)
description:
If you are an ambitious Senior Software Engineer, looking to join a rockstar engineering team that's creating a first of its kind, open platform of cognitive engines, then please continue reading!


What we're looking for:



  • Software Engineers with 5+ years of development experience, building high-performance, scalable software solutions and a reputation for doing it quickly and efficiently 

  • Expertise in our tech stack: JavaScript, Node.js, Go, AngularJS, React and Postgres

  • Familiarity with cloud-based deployments

  • Bachelor's in Computer Science


What's in it for you:



  • A competitive compensation package which includes equity

  • Quality benefits: full medical, dental, vision, 401K

  • A casual work environment, flexible hours, a fully stocked kitchen, catered lunch on Fridays

  • The opportunity to be a part of the next big thing in AI!


If you meet the above requirements and are looking to tap into your inner entrepreneurial-side, apply today for immediate consideration!

title: Sr. Mobile Developer for AI & Cyber Security Company at Cylance (Austin, TX)
description:
Cylance is a growing, cutting edge company in the Artificial Intelligence and Cyber Security space! 


We are looking for a Senior Mobile Developer to join our Consumer Engineering team.  You will be working with our engineers to develop and maintain high quality mobile applications.


This is an exciting position that will ultimately allow you to design and build the next generation of our mobile applications!  If you're passionate about mobile platforms and translating code into user-friendly apps, we'd like to meet you!


You:


- Experience with Mobile development - React Native experience preferred, but not required as long as open to developing in it


- Familiarity with JavaScript and React in Web development 


- Portfolio of released applications on the App store or Android market (or at least one example of an app that's been released)


- Both iOS and Android experience preferred - but if only one, prefer iOS


- Experience with third-party libraries and APIs and familiarity with OOP design principles 


What You Will Do:


- Support the entire application lifecycle (concept, design, test, release, and support)


- Gather requirements and suggest solutions


- Write unit and UI tests to identify malfunctions; troubleshoot and debug to optimize performance 


- Collaborate with Creative team to enhance and design the user experience;  work closely with Product Management teams to prioritize features


If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you today!

title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Veritone, Inc. (Costa Mesa, CA)
description:
We are seeking a Senior DevOps Engineer to become an integral part of our team! You will be using AWS, Terraform and Ansible to help build out our AI orchestration layer. 


At Veritone, we've developed a proprietary AI platform that unlocks the power of cognitive computing so that unstructured audio and video data can be processed, transformed, correlated and analyzed in a seamless, automated manner, generating actionable intelligence. The cloud-based, open platform integrates an ecosystem of a variety of best-of-breed cognitive engines, which can be orchestrated together to reveal valuable multivariate insights from vast amounts of data.


Our platform is built using Node.js, JavaScript, AngularJS, Go and Postgres and our team consists of some of the best and the brightest engineering minds in town. 


Qualifications:



  • Familiarity with Terraform and Ansible

  • Expertise with JavaScript or other open source programming languages

  • Knowledge of object-relational database management systems (ORDBMS) such as Postgres

  • JIRA experience for project/task management

  • Strong background working in AWS and Linux environments

  • Bachelor's in Computer Science, or a related field, from an accredited university

  • Deadline and detail-oriented

  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills


What's in it for you:



  • Extremely competitive compensation and quality benefits

  • A fully stocked kitchen in one of the most beautiful parts of Orange County

  • Flexible work hours, casual dress attire, etc…

  • Most importantly, the opportunity to be a part of the next big thing in AI!


So if you meet the above requirements and are looking to join a reputable team in the artificial intelligence space, apply today for immediate consideration!

title: Mid/Senior/Lead Scala Engineer - Scala, Spark, Hadoop at The Quantium Group (Sydney, Australia)
description:
Quantium Big Data Engineer


Since 2008, our data teams have wrung every bit of information they can from our clients’ data in order to give them the insight they need to make a real difference to their business.


Times and technology have changed, but this remains our goal. Instead of wrangling single, SQL-based databases, our MapR Hadoop platform runs across 200 nodes with multiple clusters using the latest big data technology.


Our industry-leading partners’ real-world data sets are growing along with their complexity so we need to bring more developers and engineers into our team. We’re hoping that’s you.


Working with Scala, Spark and the rest of the Hadoop ecosystem, you’ll be building applications to work with unique data sets (some of the largest and most complex in Australia) to make a real difference to our clients.


FAQ:


Is your Scala fully FP?


Not always. We focus on building highly maintainable code so there’s often a decision to make on what the best way to go is. We’re not purists, but we love to use FP where it’s the best solution


How do your teams work?


We work in multi-discipline teams so you’ll be working alongside Data Scientists, Analysts, Testers and Devops


What are you looking for in the ideal candidate?


We’re looking for Big Data Software engineers:


You’ve been working with Scala and love to play with it, you know your way around the Hadoop eco-system with Spark at the top of your go to frameworks


You’re a pragmatist, a true engineer and love to solve complex issues


You can also have a conversation about Scalaz without alienating anyone!


You haven't ticked "Do programmers have quiet working conditions?" In the Joel test?


We have an open plan office, which is normally pretty quiet, but if you want to head to a meeting room or use headphones, that's totally fine


Skills & Requirements


Do you have a bullet point checklist for me to check off my suitability?


We know people are not bullet points but sure thing!


You have:



  • Experience developing applications using Apache Spark or similar Hadoop-based big data technologies

  • Experience building Scala applications, preferably in distributed contexts (if you have a real love of Scala and are itching to move from Java, we’ll also consider it)

  • A solid foundation in functional and object-oriented programming with data structures

  • A passion for solving problems and writing efficient algorithms

  • An awareness of considerations around structuring data on distributed systems to support analytic use cases

  • A passion for delivering high-quality, peer-reviewed, well-tested code

  • A love for knowledge sharing, you know what works, but you’re also happy to learn new methods and technology

title: Sr. Python Developer at AI & Cyber Security Company at Cylance (Austin, TX)
description:
Are you interested in getting involved in the cutting-edge space of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning?  Cylance is revolutionizing cybersecurity with AI based solutions that predict and prevent execution of advanced threats and malware at the endpoint.


We looking for a talented Senior Software Engineer - Python, to design, implement, test, and maintain with an emphasis on tangible results.  You'll be joining our infrastructure team and working on bringing our micro services to support threat research operations.  You'll also research new technologies to improve existing systems and design new ones.


WHAT YOU WILL DO



  • Develop global scale RESTful APIs

  • Provide expertise on reliability, performance and scalability changes

  • Support and maintain developed code

  • Optimize deployment pipelines for python based projects

  • Be a strong team player and work well within a diverse, cross-functional team


WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR



  • Over five years of software development experience on a Unix-like system

  • Mastery of Python for application and infrastructure development

  • SDLC, source control, unit testing, agile development methodologies 

  • Collaborative and team-oriented attitude

  • Well versed with git source control

  • Experience with refactoring legacy code

  • Intellectual curiosity, humility, accountability and positive approach

title: Senior Data Engineer at 605.tv (New York, NY)
description:
We're looking for engineers with broad and deep skill sets and experiences to help move us forward. We want self-starters who will bring distinctive expertise but who are excited to step outside their comfort zone and learn new skills. If you're eager to pick up new languages, paradigms, and technologies, we want to talk.



What you'll do


Our engineers are expected to wear a number of hats and have the opportunity to touch all parts of the stack. As an engineer at 605, you might work to improve our optimization algorithms, write code using Apache Spark, participate in architectural decisions for new components, or improve performance in collaboration with DevOps. In the same week, you could work on user-facing interfaces and reports with frontend developers, write code to import, process and QC terabytes of new data, and work with analysts and statisticians to ensure the validity of our processes.


What we're looking for:



  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field (or 4 additional years of relevant work experience)

  • A strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and effective software design

  • Significant development experience with a major modern language (e.g. Java, Scala, Python, Ruby, C/C++, etc.)

  • Significant experience working with structured and unstructured data at scale and comfort with a variety of different stores (key-value, document, columnar, etc.) as well as traditional RDBMSes and data warehouses

  • Experience writing unit and functional tests

  • Comfort with version control systems (e.g. Git, SVN)

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; must work well in an agile, collaborative team environment



Any of the following will make us really excited:



  • Master's in Computer Science or a related field

  • Basic understanding of statistics and experience with statistical packages such as R, Matlab, SPSS, etc.

  • Practical experience with supervised machine learning techniques

  • Practical experience with Apache Spark

  • Experience with AWS products (Redshift, EMR, S3, IAM, RDS, etc)

  • Experience wrangling terabytes of big, complicated, imperfect data

  • Experience with front-end languages, especially Javascript, HTML5, and CSS3

  • Strong background with test-driven development

title: Tech Lead - Build the next generation of our trading engine at A Priori Investment Management (New York, NY)
description:
A Priori is seeking a technical lead/software architect to spearhead building the next generation of the high-performance historical simulation/trading engine that powers A Priori. You will have an opportunity to work closely with the firm’s founders help lead the evolution and growth of our systems from data ingestion and analysis through trade execution. 


If you are looking to take ownership of your work and make an immediate impact with the code you write, this is the opportunity for you. At A Priori, you will not be a cog in a machine; you will be a part of an interactive and collaborative team that includes the founders. You will have a direct say in the future direction of our tech infrastructure and impact the bottom line of the company meaningfully.


Areas of research and development would include:



  • Tools to process, analyze, and interact with complex financial data

  • Signal processing and optimization

  • Real-time portfolio analytics

  • Low latency event processing

  • Data analysis and integration

  • Execution engine and post-trade assessments


Requirements include:



  • Bachelors, Masters, or Ph.D. in computer science, mathematics, or physics from a top university. Advanced degree a plus

  • Minimum 5 years experience hands-on programming for large-scale software development/enterprise architecture

  • Work experience with lead role in system architecture and design to develop complex software solutions

  • Experience in Java, Python, and C++. Matlab is a plus

  • Interest in global markets

  • Experience with database design is a plus


We will only consider experienced programmers for this role.

title: Experienced Software Engineer fluent in web development at Semmle (Oxford, UK)
description:
Are you an experienced software engineer, fluent in web development? Would you like your work to make software better, not just at Semmle but globally?


As a software engineer with web expertise at Semmle, you will work on lgtm — both the public lgtm.com and the version for our enterprise customers. You will have wide-ranging responsibilities to take features and improvements from initial design discussions to deployment.


Skills & Requirements


All software engineers at Semmle are highly literate in computer science and mathematics, and can demonstrate that with a top degree in computer science (or related discipline) from a great university, or through their previous world-class work solving difficult technical problems.


In addition, we will ask you to tell us about the successful interactive and visual web-applications you’ve built in the past. We are looking for those who can be productive straight away evolving the lgtm frontend using React, D3, TypeScript, and server-side Java.


You have enough knowledge of visual design to articulate the design elements and principles employed in a design, and are careful about maintaining those conventions and the overall style in your daily work.

title: FPGA Verification Engineer at Hudson River Trading (New York, NY)
description:
Are you passionate about hardware verification? Can you find that obscure bug others would have missed? Think there's opportunity to improve upon today's EDA tools, and have ideas how to make that happen? If so, let's talk.

We are looking for an experienced verification engineer who dreams about writing fabulously malicious testbenches to exercise complex hardware, likes being challenged, hates to climb corporate ladders, and doesn't mind the added bonus of having hard work rewarded through recognition and extremely competitive compensation. FPGA verification is part of a small but growing team at HRT which is integral to ensuring the success of our trading in the future. You can expect to always be challenged by the ever-changing financial markets as you work on critical hardware and software in an extremely fast-paced, real-time environment.

At HRT, we're creating the verification environment of tomorrow. We prefer lightweight and open source. Our ideal candidate is not only an ace tester, but a practicing toolsmith. You know the EDA landscape intimately, and want to be part of a team actively working to rethink, redesign, and surpass the status quo.



The Skills:



  • Demonstrated interest or ideally experience in HW (FPGA or ASIC)

  • Understands low-level computer architecture (bits, registers, muxes)

  • Experience in either HW or SW test (knows how to find and exercise corner cases etc.)

  • Excellent scripting and automation skills (ideally Python)

  • C++ programming skills with an understanding of the language (abstraction mechanisms, STL)

  • Optimization, design, debugging and problem solving skills

  • Expertise with UNIX operating systems (we use Linux), system/processor performance, and network communication

  • Some familiarity with SystemVerilog and UVM


The Profile:



  • You are unafraid to challenge industry conventions when necessary, and can prove it

  • In your spare time you: code, tinker, read, explore, break things, and have an insatiable curiosity for all things computer related... you'll find like-minded people here.

  • You possess a bachelor's degree in Computer or Electircal Engineering or a related field

  • You are capable of working independently as well as part of a team

  • You can analyze and fix problems quickly

  • You can look at code, figure out how it works, and make it better

  • You can describe hardware designs at a high level, low level, or anywhere in between

  • You want to work with people who challenge you and make you better at what you do -- you'll find them here in abundance!



Culture


Hudson River Trading brings a scientific approach to trading financial products. We have built one of the world's most sophisticated computing environments for research and development. Our researchers are at the forefront of innovation in the world of algorithmic trading.


At HRT we are mathematicians, computer scientists, statisticians, physicists and engineers. We research and develop automated trading algorithms using advanced mathematical techniques. We have a fun and casual office atmosphere, but everyone works diligently to get the job done. We boast a flat management structure as all our people are motivated by the excitement of being at the forefront of the automated trading world. No politics or red tape impede the generation or implementation of ideas.

title: Medior Cloud Native Developer (Fluent in Dutch & English) at Capgemini Nederland (Utrecht, Netherlands)
description:
You design and build cloud native solutions that give banks and insurers a head start in their new digital world.


What will you be doing


For projects in the Financial Services sector we are looking for a Cloud Native Developer. You will be part of our squad that on a daily base develops new killer apps for our financial customers. You will have a complete playground/garage at your disposal where you have access to the latest application frameworks, cloud technologies, experts and relevant customer use stories. This is where you can really bring live to your hackathon prototype babies that just needed a little more TLC.  


Qualifications




  • Experience in developing cloud based applications over platforms like Azure / AWS/ Open-stack/Cloud Foundry




  • Experience in REST Services and HTTP over REST




  • Experience with emerging PaaS solutions




  • Previous experience with Cloud Foundry PaaS system is a plus




  • Prior experience migrating traditional applications to cloud platforms




  • Experience with emerging open standards such as OpenStack, Puppet, Docker etc…




  • Experience with JEE technology platforms




  • Development background is a must




  • WebSphere Application Servers v7.x, v8.x, Liberty JBoss EAP 5.x, 6.x




  • Experience with Open Technology runtimes and components Node.js, Spring Boot, Python, etc.




  • Good level backend Java Development experience: Java, Spring Hibernate




  • Strong agile background with good knowledge around best practices




Our offer




  • A contract of indefinite duration




  • Excellent facilities for flexible working




  • A pension contribution




  • A year-end bonus




  • 26 days of paid leave




  • A mobility allowance

title: Software Engineer, Data Platform at Cortico (Cambridge, MA)
description:
You are a backend engineer who will help build out the Cortico platform. Your role will be focused on core infrastructure, from devops through data pipelines and APIs. Typical day-to-day activities will include: evaluating and deploying new and emerging data-management technologies, coding at all levels of the data stack, and integrating the latest advances in machine-learning-based data analysis as developed by MIT Media Lab researchers. You will have access to the Media Lab to learn the latest methods home brewed at the lab.


Python is our go-to language because it offers good support for core use-cases of applied machine learning, API development, data pipelines, and devops tooling. We use elasticsearch for search and for text analytics, and evaluate other data-management technologies (Hadoop/Hive, Spark, PrestoDB) for inclusion in the platform as our requirements evolve. We appreciate AWS’s power and flexibility, if not all its warts, so we use AWS services extensively. Familiarity with all of these technologies is not required, but interest and willingness to learn certainly is.

title: Lead and Senior Java Engineer (Dutch based) at Capgemini Nederland (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
You design and build innovative solutions that give banks and insurers a head start in their new digital world.


Are you ready to harvest? Do you want to work for a startup in the heart of Amsterdam that has all the big customers and interesting projects?  A startup that does not have to fight for its existence but can leverage on years of relationship with their customers from its mother company Capgemini?  A startup that does not run out of projects and where you can easily switch from one technology to another? A startup that will enable you to bring your Hackathon babies alive!
Innovation, creativity, knowledge and personal development is in our DNA. You will not only be designing and developing but also be coaching, blogging and will speak at the best congresses. With your passion for innovation you make sure that our customers get a solid lead in the digital world. We are the Mr. Wolfs for the companies we deal with. We focus on the required outcome, fix it and are on our way to our next assignment. What will you be doing
You have a passion for innovation and know how to use your coding skills to give large banks and insurers a solid lead in the digital world. You will work in multidisciplinary Agile teams on innovative solutions. Your advice and POC will amaze our customers and they will want this to be implemented as soon as possible. Together with us you will determine the standards of sound software engineering.
You will have a complete playground/garage at your disposal where you have access to the latest application frameworks, cloud technologies, experts and relevant customer use stories. This is where you can really bring live to your hackathon prototype babies that just needed a little more TLC.
Are you ready to join a startup that works with all the new technologies, partners with Fintechs and offers great assignments and brilliant colleagues? How do you qualify? 
Well, we ask you to come prepared and would like to hear your story and see what you have in your “rucksack” already. Tel us about:
• Your latest and greatest project you’ve developed;
• Your story on how you work with Docker, Kafka and Cloud platforms;
• Your experience with different API frameworks and what you have learned working with them;
• Your view on the pros en cons of working in an Agile environment;
• A situation that shows your strong communication skills and ability to present ideas;
• Your story on what is the advantage of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery;
• Your experience in mentoring and coaching colleagues;
• Your vision on how to apply testing. Our offer
Next to brilliant colleagues, the best projects and a great office in the heart of Amsterdam we offer:
• Competitive salary package
• Pension benefits
• Permanent contract
• Excellent facilities for flexible working
• A quartely bonus
• 26 days of paid leave

title: Lead and Senior Javascript Engineer (Dutch based) at Capgemini Nederland (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
You design and build innovative solutions that give banks and insurers a head start in their new digital world.


Are you ready to harvest?
Do you want to work for a startup in the heart of Amsterdam that has all the big customers and interesting projects?  A startup that does not have to fight for its existence but can leverage on years of relationship with their customers from its mother company Capgemini?  A startup that does not run out of projects and where you can easily switch from one technology to another? • Your latest and greatest project (using JavaScript) you’ve developed;
• Your story on how you work with SystemJS or NodeJS;
• Your experience with different UI frameworks and what you have learned working with them;
• Your view on the pros en cons of working in an Agile environment;

title: Senior Data Developer at 84.51Â° (Cincinnati, OH)
description:
Sr. Data Developer – What you’ll do


As a data developer, we develop strategies and solutions to ingest, store and distribute our big data. Our developers use Scala, Hadoop, Spark, Hive, JSON, and SQL in 10 week long scrum teams to developer the products, tools and features.



Responsibilities


Take ownership of features and drive them to completion through all phases of the entire 84.51° SDLC.  This includes external facing and internal applications as well as process improvement activities such as:



  • Lead design of Hadoop and SQL based solutions

  • Perform development of Hadoop and SQL based solutions

  • Perform unit and integration testing

  • Collaborate with senior resources to ensure consistent development practices

  • Provide mentoring to junior resources

  • Participate in retrospective reviews

  • Participate in the estimation process for new work and releases

  • Bring new perspectives to problems

  • Be driven to improve yourself and the way things are done


Education



Requirements



  • Bachelor’s degree typically in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Mathematics, Business Analytics or another technically strong program.

  • 5+ years proven ability of professional data development experience

  • Strong understanding of Agile Principles (Scrum)

  • Proficient with relational data modeling



  • 5+ years proven ability of developing with SQL (Oracle, SQLServer)



  • 5+ years proven ability of developing with Hadoop/HDFS

  • Full understanding of ETL concepts

  • Full understanding of data warehousing concepts

  • Exposure to VCS (Git, SVN)

  • 3+ year developing experience with either Java, Scala or Python

  • Experience with Spark



Preferred Skills – Experience in the following



  • Exposure to NoSQL (Mongo, Cassandra)

  • SOA

  • Junit

  • CI/CD

title: Rails Developer at StreamDetroit (Ferndale, MI)
description:
Work alongside with our core product team and a Ph.D. in AI mentor. 


We are building the next version (2.0) of our core Managerial Analytics product called Network Relationship Management.  


We are software engineers, statisticians, mathematicians, domain experts and analysts and are looking for someone who can add something new to the team.  


These are the kinds of things that we are working on this month:



  • Networking the networking apps

  • Mobile machine learning (Think HotDog, Not HotDog)

  • Apps running on our micro services written in the best tool for the job

  • Integrating VueJS into Rails


We work with Ruby, Rails, Ember, VueJS, NodeJS and all kinds of JavaScript


If you craft a couple of paragraphs explaining the work you are doing and how you think it can add value, then I (the hiring decision maker) will respond to your application and at least acknowledge you, starting the conversation.  Please point to some URLs to projects, research...anything that you are working on...I'll reciprocate.  You'd be surprised at how many random resumes I get that say literally nothing about the person.  I get it, sometimes it's like throwing a resume into a black hole, but take a few minutes to communicate with me as a person, and I'll return the favor.

title: DevOps Engineer - Networks at Hudson River Trading (New York, NY)
description:
The Networks team designs, builds and deploys all the infrastructure that allows our global trading and research environment to run 24/7.  We are looking for an all-star developer who's excited to learn the details of how data is routed around the internet, or a seasoned network engineer who is more excited about APIs than CLIs and has the programming skills to match.  Project areas will include building tools for configuration management, automation, monitoring, and performance analysis. You will work closely with our systems and operations teams as well as others at HRT to build, manage, and monitor our cutting edge R&D cluster environment and ultra low latency trade network.


In this position, you’ll have broad responsibilities and freedom to analyze and solve problems, and your solutions will have an immediate impact on our operations worldwide. We’re looking for someone who is excited about tackling big picture problems, working on a wide variety of projects and technologies, and learning the nitty-gritty of the networking and systems sides of our global architecture.


The Skills:



  • Excellent design, debugging, and troubleshooting skills

  • Experience in Python is great, but good CS fundamentals and enthusiasm about learning Python are required

  • Experience with some of the following technologies and tools: Grafana, ElasticSearch, Influxdb, Graphite, Nagios, Zenoss, Cacti

  • Exposure to these protocols is beneficial: OSPF, BGP, PIM, IGMP

  • Experience with Unix/Linux command line and networking stack

  • Experience with high performance computing development and administration is beneficial

  • Familiarity with systems configuration management and monitoring technologies


The Profile:



  • BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or IT

  • 1-5 years of experience

  • Adept in at least one higher level language such as Python

  • Understanding of networking basics

  • Ability to debug and fix problems quickly

  • Ability to look at code, figure out how it works, and how to make it better

  • Ability to multitask and retain a high attention to detail and priorities

  • Eager to learn and apply new skills quickly

  • You enjoy tinkering with technology in your spare time

  • You have excellent communication skills and a willingness to admit mistakes

title: Operations Developer at Hudson River Trading (New York, NY)
description:
The Operations team is responsible for managing HRT's live trading environment. We play a role in everything that HRT does to create and maintain the most robust and efficient trading platform in the world.  An Ops Developer might work on Ops-specific tools, take on development projects with Core or Algo, or tackle challenges facing other areas of the company.  Project areas include: market access, monitoring and compliance, algo/strategy evaluation and management, performance tuning, and trading automation.  Anything that would touch our globally distributed production environment is fair game!


Being an Ops Developer means working on a tight-knit, highly productive team. You’ll be in charge of designing new systems that impact the whole company, debugging mission critical software under time pressure, hacking your way through old scripts, and reviewing pull requests -- all in a day’s work. We release a lot of code (usually daily, sometimes hourly!) that reaches into every department and every office at HRT.  As an Ops Developer you'll establish a deep knowledge of Python, C++, OS internals, CPU architecture, network hardware and protocol, individual market behavior, firm risk controls/risk management, algorithm design, and strategy management.



We're looking for someone who loves technology and wants to work on a broad range of projects using whatever tool(s) best solve the problem at hand.  Excellent communication is a must, along with a can-do attitude.
 

The Skills


  • Excellent design, debugging and problem solving skills

  • Some experience in C++ and Python is great (not required), but good CS fundamentals and enthusiasm about learning C++ and Python is required

  • Knowledge of UNIX operating systems (we use Linux), system/processor performance, and network communication






The Profile



  • You attained a Bachelor’s in Computer Science or have commensurate experience

  • You are adept in at least one higher level language such as Python (preferred) or C++

  • You have experience working with databases (SQL, MongoDB, Redis)

  • You can analyze and fix problems quickly

  • You can look at code, figure out how it works, and how to make it better

  • You really like to work with people who challenge you and make you better at what you do

  • You have excellent communication skills and a willingness to admit mistakes

  • Experience with (or a strong interest in learning!) UI Design / PyQt / HTML / CSS

title: Experienced software engineer to build robust systems at Semmle (Oxford, UK)
description:
Are you an experienced software engineer who has helped build robust systems that span tens or hundreds of machines? Would you like your work to make software better, not just at Semmle but globally?


As a software engineer at Semmle with experience of robust distributed systems, you will work on lgtm — both the public lgtm.com that daily analyses changes to over 31,000 of the most popular open-source repositories in the world, and the private lgtm enterprise, which does the same job for our customers’ proprietary software.

title: C# language analysis research engineer at Semmle (Oxford, UK)
description:
Are you an expert C# programmer, familiar with the latest language features and libraries? Do you enjoy tinkering with the internals of the CLR or the Roslyn framework? Do you want to work on cutting-edge analysis of C# code?


As a software engineer working on C# analysis at Semmle, you will help people make software better by using advanced program analysis to find security flaws and bugs in their programs, creating the raw results to serve on lgtm.

title: Medior Agile API Developer (Fluent in Dutch & English) at Capgemini Nederland (Utrecht, Netherlands)
description:
You connect the dots and bring the right data to the world.


What will you be doing


For projects in the Financial Services sector we are looking for an Agile API Developer. You will work in multidisciplinary Agile teams on innovative solutions for our Top Finance Customers. As Agile API Developer you help move our clients to adopt cloud native applications, develop microservices architecture and connect these applications to the backend world. Your coding skills will give large banks and insurers a solid lead in the digital world. Together with our architects you will design and build the best solution for the required situation using RESTful and integration services. Next to hands-on coding you will also be coaching colleagues on the job.


Responsibilities:




  • Participate in the design approach for API based middleware projects, including selection of technologies.




  • Good knowledge of software design patterns and ability to apply them using J2EE and API tools (Mulesoft, WSO2, Apigee, Azure, AWS etc) and features




  • Define standards and guidelines for building API Service Layer, Security, Versioning, Encryption using API Gateway

Qualifications:

Our offer

  • A pension contribution

title: Full Stack Rails Developer at Location, Inc (Worcester, MA)
description:
We are a fun and exciting web application and Big Data company. In order to meet an ever-increasing public demand, we are looking to hire a Lead Ruby on Rails Developer with outstanding web development and leadership experience. This is an exceptional opportunity for a great developer to become the lead engineer of a small, growing and profitable, venture-backed company. 


Looking to make a move? This position will work from our offices in Worcester, MA. (Read further about our location, below!) Relocation assistance will be offered for the right out-of-area candidate.


What You’ll Be Doing:


Leading the incorporation of new features to our newly rearchitected and most popular product.


Serving as the Sr. developer and team lead in the technical development of our other real estate and map-based information products 


Solving challenging problems working with massive datasets that include crime statistics, schools, lifestyles, neighborhoods and more 


Working in an Agile environment writing code and tests you can be proud of 


Keeping existing products up-to-date with the latest technologies, architectures, and standards 


Advise other parts of the business on technical capabilities and options


Working alongside a nimble, cohesive engineering team 


Collaborating with PhD Geographers and Statisticians to create new, disruptive products


What’s In it For You?



  • Help people improve their lives, and businesses improve their bottom lines, by helping them find their ideal locations.

  • A casual, fun working environment, solving some of the most exhilarating Big Data problems in the industry, alongside a team that’s as passionate as you are about this stuff!

  • Competitive salary and great benefits (401(k), medical coverage, 5 weeks paid personal time each year)

  • Great work/life balance, with 40-45 hour work weeks the norm!

  • Long-term stability with a venture backed start up that is already profitable and growing

  • Investors include the Founders of MapQuest and CoreLogic


Required Skills & Experience:



  • 5+ years designing and implementing complex, data-heavy web applications 

  • 5+ years’ experience with Ruby on Rails and PostgreSQL / relational databases, AWS



  • 3+ years’ front end development experience with JavaScript, jQuery, HTML, CSS

  • Experience with design and building Web API development



  • Experience as a small team leader, tech-lead or similar role 

  • Self-directed time management, documentation and communication skills 

  • Proven, effective ability to work with others

  • To be passionate about your craft and entrepreneurial in thinking about how engineering can solve business problems


An ideal candidate would also possess:  



  • Experience HAML, SASS

  • DevOps experience particularly with Chef and Engine Yard

  • Data mining experience 

  • Scaling and performance tuning of high-traffic, data-heavy sites;  Google Maps JavaScript APIs


Our Environment



  • Hand coded Rails 4 & 5, Ruby 2.3, 2.4, HTML5/CSS3, JavaScript/jQuery 

  • OpenStreetMap, Google Maps API, Engine Yard, Amazon AWS, PostgreSQL/PostGIS 

  • We use all of your favorite tools: JIRA, Confluence,  Bitbucket, HipChat, GitHub, Chef, Puppet, Basecamp, Pivotal Tracker, etc.


Our Location



  • Yards away from commuter rail hub, highway, pubs, restaurants and coffee shops.

  • 5 miles in any direction and you are in quaint New England towns with nationally-ranked schools, historic charm, and great housing options (and we would know, we’re the experts!).


Company Description


Our client is a small, high-end geospatial analysis Company born of university research, specializing in location-based decision-making tools:  analytics, information and data.  We license geospatial risk analytics and SaaS products for a host of business to business applications, and run the largest neighborhood search engine in the world, and “the most trusted source for choosing a neighborhood,” according to Money® Magazine.

title: Quality Assurance Engineer at Location, Inc (Worcester, MA)
description:
We are a fun and exciting web application and Big Data company. In order to meet an ever- increasing public demand, we are looking to hire a driven Quality Assurance Engineer to join our Ruby on Rails product development hosted on AWS. This is an exceptional opportunity to join our small, growing and profitable, venture-backed company.



This position will work from our offices in Worcester, MA. (Read further about our location, below!) Relocation assistance will be offered for the right out-of-area candidate.



What’s in it For You?



  • Help large and small businesses of all stripes make informed decisions by predicting future opportunities and risks at any location – crime, fires, investing futures, and more.

  • A casual, fun working environment, solving some of the most exhilarating Big Data problems in the industry, alongside a team that’s as passionate as you are about this stuff!

  • Competitive salary and great benefits (401(k), medical coverage, 5 weeks paid personal time each year)

  • Great work/life balance, with 40-45 hour work weeks the norm!

  • Long-term stability with a venture backed start up that is already profitable and growing

  • Investors include the Founders of MapQuest and CoreLogic



Responsibilities:



  • Create and maintain test plans for new and existing features.

  • Test browser based applications from UX/UI as well functional testing.

  • Ability to triage issues as they arise from customer support, management or your teammates.

  • Lead and Support efforts to automate testing.

  • Keep all departments updated on status of release and communicate obstacles and testing risks.



  • Contribute to the development and release of NeighborhoodScout and SecurityGauge

  • Support IT functions hosting services on AWS, continuous integration, test automation and manual testing.

  • Use modern infrastructure tools and platforms to automate our systems

  • Solve challenging problems working with massive datasets that include crime statistics, schools, predicting real estate values years into the future, predict fire and water damage, and more

  • Collaborate with PhD Geographers and Statisticians to deliver new, disruptive products



Requirements:



  • 3+ years professional work experience

  • Proficient with Amazon Web Services (EC2, RDS, SQS, CloudFront), Route53, ELB

  • Tools: JIRA, Confluence, Bitbucket, HipChat, Github, Chef, Puppet

  • Continuous integration, Version Control Systems (Semaphore, Jenkins), Test Automation

  • Experience or exposure to Agile/SCRUM is ideal

  • RSpec, Capabara, Selenium, Code coverage tools

  • Experience with API testing

  • Passion for breaking things!



Familiarity with the following is a strong plus:



  • MVC frameworks (Ruby on Rails, Symfony, Spring, Grails) a strong plus

  • HTML/JS frameworks (jQuery, Bootstrap, Foundation)

  • Frameworks: Ruby on Rails, Bootstrap, etc.

  • Jira for Bug Tracking and Reporting



Our Location:


Yards away from commuter rail hub, highway, pubs, restaurants and coffee shops.


5 miles in any direction and you are in quaint New England towns with nationally-ranked schools, historic charm, and great housing options (and we would know, we’re the experts!).


Interested?


Tell us about yourself and why you would like to work with us! Email careers at locationinc dot com and include a link to your website / portfolio / GitHub / LinkedIn.


Company Description


Location, Inc. is a small, high-end geospatial analysis Company born of university research, specializing in location-based decision-making tools: analytics, information and data. We license geospatial risk analytics and SaaS products for a host of business to business applications, and run NeighborhoodScout.com, the largest neighborhood search engine in the world, and _“the most trusted source for choosing a neighborhood,”_ according to *Money* ® *Magazine* .


Location, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.
